title: '34 vehicles ready with human bombs': Lashkar-e-Jihadi sends warning; Mumbai on high alert
content: Mumbai Police are on high alert. A threat message warned of multiple terror attacks. The message claimed 34 vehicles are fitted with human bombs. Lashkar-e-Jihadi claimed responsibility. They said 14 Pakistani terrorists entered India. The threat mentioned 400 kg of RDX explosives. Mumbai Police are investigating the threat. Security has been tightened across the city.

title: Rs 60 crore 'cheating case': Lookout circular for Shilpa Shetty, Raj Kundra
content: Mumbai police have issued a Lookout Circular against Shilpa Shetty and Raj Kundra concerning a Rs 60 crore cheating case. The Economic Offences Wing took this action due to the couple's frequent international travel. The case, registered at Juhu police station, alleges they defrauded a businessman in a loan-cum-investment deal.

title: Mid-air scare: AI Express' Delhi-Indore flight issues PAN-PAN call over engine fault
content: An Air India Express flight from Delhi to Indore experienced an engine problem mid-air. The pilot sent a 'PAN-PAN' alert. This signaled a non-critical emergency. The plane landed safely in Indore with a slight delay. Airport authorities took precautions. All 161 passengers and crew are safe. The aircraft landed at Devi Ahilyabai Holkar Airport.

title: GST 2.0: Full comprehensive list of items with revised rates
content: New GST rates 2025 full list: The Finance Minister announced significant GST rate cuts and slab changes, effective September 22, 2025, leading to cheaper daily-use items. Many food items will attract 0% GST, and life and health insurance will also see zero tax. The government is monitoring price changes, while luxury and sin goods may face higher taxes, potentially reaching a 40% bracket.

title: From plush to slush: Yamuna floodwaters swamp Noida‚Äôs luxury farmhouses
content: Rising Yamuna floodwaters have submerged luxury farmhouses along the Noida floodplain, reviving memories of last year's devastating inundation. Caretakers are evacuating properties as the river approaches record levels, impacting over 1,000 farmhouses with lavish amenities.

title: Dinner diplomacy: Trump hosts dinner for tech CEOs; gives '3-word description' for Cook & others
content: US President Donald Trump hosted tech CEOs, including Tim Cook, Satya Nadella, and Sundar Pichai, at the White House, calling them a "high IQ group." Discussions centered on AI, with Pichai praising the administration's 'AI Action Plan.' Google pledged a $250 billion US investment, while Microsoft invests $75-$80 billion annually.

title: Watch: Army's daring night evacuation in Ladakh; 2 South Korean nationals rescued
content: The Indian Army swiftly responded to a distress call on September 4th, launching a rescue operation to evacuate two South Korean nationals stranded at the Kongmarula Pass in Ladakh. Helicopters were deployed within 15 minutes of receiving the request, successfully airlifting the individuals from the high-altitude location around 9:15 pm.

title: NIRF rankings 2025: Hindu, Miranda House remain best two colleges of India
content: Delhi University (DU) continues its dominance in the NIRF 2025 rankings, securing top positions with 32 colleges on the list. Hindu College and Miranda House retain their top spots, while DU achieves its best-ever fifth position among universities. Other Delhi institutions like JNU and Jamia Millia Islamia also shine, with AIIMS Delhi leading in medical and dental categories.

title: US Open: 'Goldfish' Amanda Anisimova goes from rock bottom to cusp of success
content: Amanda Anisimova has learned to forget, reset, and fight again. Just 54 days after her crushing 0-6, 0-6 Wimbledon final loss, the 24-year-old American is back on the biggest stage ‚Äî this time at the US Open. With belief, grit, and booming winners, she now stands one match away from her first Grand Slam crown, just 61 miles from where she was born.

title: GST rate cut: TVs, ACs, laptops see relief; what happens to mobile phones
content: The GST Council has approved a revised two-tier rate structure, reducing the slabs to 5% and 18%, effective September 22. Consumer electronics like TVs, air conditioners, and dishwashers will see a price cut as they move from the 28% to the 18% GST slab. However, mobile phones and laptops will continue to be taxed at 18%.

title: 'Locked himself in bathroom': This actor recalls school bullying; shares story
content: Hrithik Roshan, celebrated for his acting, dance, and looks, overcame a difficult childhood marked by stuttering and a spinal problem that doctors said would prevent him from becoming an actor. He faced immense challenges, including locking himself in a bathroom to practice speaking without stammering.

title: ‚ÄòWill be legitimate targets‚Äô: Vladimir Putin warns of direct attacks in Ukraine
content: President Putin warned that any Western troops deployed to Ukraine would be considered legitimate targets, following pledges of postwar security guarantees including an international force. He argued such deployments wouldn't ensure lasting peace, citing growing military ties as a conflict root cause. Macron criticized Russia's troop movements despite ceasefire talks. Recent large-scale Russian attacks targeted Western Ukraine.

title: Maharashtra minister becomes 1st Tesla owner: Pratak Sarnaik takes 'Y' model home
content: Maharashtra Transport Minister Pratap Sarnaik received the first Tesla Model Y in Mumbai, aiming to promote electric vehicle adoption. He intends to gift the car to his grandson, fostering early awareness of green mobility. Maharashtra is committed to EV transition with incentives and MSRTC's procurement of 5,000 e-buses, aligning with the Prime Minister's clean mobility vision.

title: Amazon's cost-cutting rule: New phone policy; Staff must report personal usage
content: Amazon is monitoring employee phone usage. Workers must now report the percentage of work-related use on company phones. Reimbursements will be adjusted accordingly. This is part of cost-cutting measures under CEO Andy Jassy. Employees are expressing concerns about micromanagement. Amazon defends the policy as a return to its performance-driven roots. Other companies are also tightening expense policies.

title: ‚ÄòIllegitimate targeting‚Äô: US puts sanctions on Palestinian rights groups
content: The U.S. sanctioned three Palestinian human rights organizations for allegedly instigating the International Criminal Court's (ICC) investigation into Israel, according to the Treasury Department. Secretary Rubio stated the groups targeted Israeli nationals without consent, prompting the action. The ICC's later arrest warrants for Israeli and Hamas leaders over war crimes allegations further fueled the controversy.

title: Exclusive | From Rs 1 coins to defeating Divya Deshmukh: Abhimanyu Puranik‚Äôs journey
content: Divya Deshmukh, after her Women's World Cup victory, revealed her mentors, Csaba Balogh and Abhimanyu Puranik. At the Grand Swiss 2025, Puranik, who had just enjoyed a Disneyland vacation, defeated his prot√©g√©, Divya. Puranik, a Mumbai-born Punekar, started chess at five and praised Divya's amazing mentality and potential for future dominance in Indian chess.

title: Mike Tyson and Floyd Mayweather: Fight date set; latest details out
content: Boxing legends Mike Tyson and Floyd Mayweather Jr. are set to clash in an exhibition match in Spring 2026, confirmed by CSI Sports/Fight Sports. The highly anticipated event pits Tyson's aggressive style against Mayweather's defensive prowess. Both fighters have expressed excitement and surprise, promising a legendary showdown for fans worldwide, though the specific date and venue remain undisclosed.

title: Clash over 'samosas': UP man thrashed with kicks and punches by wife, in-laws
content: In Pilibhit, a domestic dispute over samosas turned violent when Shivam Kumar failed to bring them home as requested by his wife, Sangeeta. The argument escalated the next day, leading to Sangeeta, along with her parents and uncle, allegedly assaulting Shivam. Police have registered an FIR, and an investigation is underway to determine the full scope of the incident.

title: Messi not playing WC 2026? He says: 'It's only logical to think I might not'
content: Lionel Messi is uncertain about participating in the 2026 World Cup to defend Argentina's title, citing his age and physical condition as key factors. After scoring twice in a 3-0 victory against Venezuela, the 38-year-old stated he will assess his fitness and performance throughout the upcoming season before making a final decision.

title: 'Bidi-Bihar' row: Deleted Cong post on GST sparks backlash; BJP hits back
content: A social media post by the Kerala Congress linking GST reforms to Bihar has ignited a political firestorm. The now-deleted post, referencing reduced taxes on bidis, was slammed by BJP and JD(U) leaders as an insult to the state and its people. The controversy has intensified ahead of Bihar's assembly elections, with the BJP-JD(U) alliance using it to attack Congress.

title: 'Phone call' halts mining crackdown: Trouble for Ajit Pawar over ‚Äòthreat‚Äô to cop?
content: Maharashtra's Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar faces accusations of obstructing IPS officer Anjana Krishna's efforts to curb illegal sand mining in Solapur. A video circulating online purportedly captures Pawar instructing Krishna to halt action against an NCP member involved. Opposition leaders are demanding an apology, alleging Pawar threatened the officer after she insisted on verifying his identity.

title: Joe Biden undergoes skin cancer surgery, fresh videos show head wound - watch
content: Ex-US President, Joe Biden, was recently spotted with a visible mark on his head. Reports confirm that the 82-year-old underwent Mohs surgery for skin cancer treatment. Biden was seen leaving a church in Rehoboth Beach with a bandage. Earlier, he was seen wearing a cap to conceal the wound. In May, aides disclosed Biden's diagnosis of Stage 4 prostate cancer. Biden shared a message about strength in difficult times.

title: ‚ÄòWill restore Amma‚Äôs rule‚Äô: Sasikala rakes up AIADMK unity debate; signals political comeback
content: VK Sasikala has reignited the AIADMK leadership debate, asserting the party's need for unity to challenge the DMK in the 2026 elections. Senior leader K A Sengottaiyan supports Sasikala, urging EPS to reconcile with former members.

title: NIRF 2025: IIM Ahmedabad ranks first again in management, check top 10 here
content: IIM Ahmedabad has secured the top spot in the NIRF 2025 management institute rankings for the sixth consecutive year. IIM Bangalore and IIM Kozhikode follow closely behind. While IIMs dominate, non-IIMs like IIT Delhi's DMS, MDI Gurgaon, and XLRI Jamshedpur also feature in the top 10, showcasing a diverse range of quality management education options in India.

title: Who is Mitesh Khapra? The IIT Madras professor featured in TIME Magazine
content: Mitesh Khapra, IIT Madras professor, features in TIME's 2025 AI 100 list. He is recognised for NLP and machine learning contributions. Khapra focuses on AI systems for India's diverse languages. His work addresses challenges in English-centric AI models. He aims to make AI accessible across India. AI4Bharat, his project, builds datasets for Indian languages. This initiative supports government's Bhashini mission.

title: Is it a bank holiday on September 5? Check details
content: Banks across multiple Indian states remained closed on September 5 due to Id-E-Milad and Thiruvonam, as per the RBI holiday calendar. While digital banking services continued uninterrupted, physical branch visits were necessary for certain transactions. Maharashtra, however, shifted the Eid-e-Milad holiday in Mumbai to September 8, 2025, impacting government securities and related markets.

title: Tim Cook, Sundar Pichai and more: Trump hosts White House dinner; Musk absent
content: US president Trump hosted tech leaders, including Bill Gates and Mark Zuckerberg, at the White House to discuss AI and US investments. The meeting highlighted the growing influence of Indian-American executives in Silicon Valley. Trump downplayed jobs data, mentioned speaking with Putin, and Google's CEO expressed relief over the antitrust case's end.

title: 'Department of war': Why Trump wants to rename Pentagon; executive order likely today
content: President Trump is set to sign an executive order allowing the Pentagon to be referred to as the "Department of War," a secondary designation endorsed by Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth. Trump hinted at the change, recalling the department's historical name during World Wars. This move follows Hegseth's actions to reverse earlier policies, including reattributing Confederate-era fort names.

title: 5th death in 10 months: BITS Pilani Goa student found dead on campus
content: Rishi Nair, a 19-year-old BITS Pilani Goa student from Bengaluru, was found dead in his hostel room, marking the fifth student death in ten months. Police report Rishi was battling depression following his girlfriend's suicide. His parents had moved him to the Goa campus for support.

title: World No. 5 GM Muzychuk forgets about clock, suffers massive setback at Grand Swiss
content: The FIDE Grand Swiss witnessed a stunning upset as Hungarian teenager Zs√≥ka Ga√°l defeated world No. 5 Anna Muzychuk. Reigning world champion D Gukesh of India began strongly, defeating Etienne Bacrot, while Praggnanandhaa drew with Jeffery Xiong. In other matches, Vaishali secured a win, adding to the excitement of the tournament's opening day.

title: Series of earthquakes hit Afghanistan days after quake killed over 2,000
content: A series of earthquakes, including a 5.2 magnitude tremor, have struck Afghanistan's Hindukush region, causing widespread devastation. The quakes have resulted in over 2,200 fatalities and 3,000 injuries, exacerbating an already dire humanitarian situation worsened by recent flash floods. International aid is being mobilized, with the WFP dispatching emergency supplies and India airlifting relief materials to assist affected communities.

title: Dramatic arrest in Kannauj: SP leader Kaish Khan found hiding in mattress
content: Kaish Khan, a Samajwadi Party leader and former treasurer, was apprehended in Kannauj for violating a banishment order. Authorities had instructed Khan to remain outside the district limits on July 28. Acting on a tip, Kotwali police discovered him concealed in the loft of his residence.

title: Giorgio Armani dies at 91: Built a $10 billion fashion empire
content: Giorgio Armani, the iconic Italian fashion designer renowned for his elegant and sophisticated designs, has passed away at the age of 91. Credited with redefining modern Italian style through minimalist designs and timeless sophistication, Armani's creations graced red carpets and boardrooms alike. He built his independent fashion house into a global powerhouse, leaving an indelible mark on the fashion world.

title: Massive blast at Nagpur RDX plant: Shockwaves damaged buildings 2km away
content: A powerful explosion at Solar Defence and Aerospace Limited's RDX facility near Nagpur claimed one life and injured over 25. The blast, which occurred post-midnight, demolished the unit and sent shockwaves kilometers away. This marks the second fatal incident at the defence manufacturer in two years, raising concerns about safety lapses.

title: 'Baaghi 4' advance BO collection day 1: Tiger Shroff, Sanjay Dutt starrer makes comeback
content: Tiger Shroff's 'Baaghi 4', also starring Sanjay Dutt, is poised for a strong opening, with advance bookings nearing 2 lakh tickets. The film has already grossed ‚Çπ7.4 crore in advance sales, with Maharashtra, Delhi NCR, and Gujarat leading in bookings.

title: Watch: Putin goes full Gen Z, learns what 'chill sesh' and 'total cringe' mean
content: At the Eastern Economic Forum, Vladimir Putin explored Gen Z slang while promoting regional development and Asia-Pacific cooperation. He visited the National Centre ‚ÄúRussia‚Äù and learned youth lingo translations. Beyond this lighthearted moment, Putin emphasized infrastructure projects and deeper energy cooperation, linking the Far East's growth to Russia's pivot toward Asia.

title: Punjab floods: CM Mann catches fever, skips tour of affected areas; toll 43
content: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, down with viral fever, missed accompanying Arvind Kejriwal on a tour of flood-affected areas. Kejriwal, after visiting Mann, assessed the flood situation in Sultanpur Lodhi. His visit coincides with controversy surrounding AAP MLA Harmeet Singh Pathanmajra, accused of rape and other charges. Pathanmajra's arrest attempt sparked a political row, with allegations of revenge politics surfacing.

title: Battered North India logs its rainiest 2-week period in 14 years
content: North India experienced unprecedented rainfall between August 22 and September 4, with nearly three times the normal amount. This intense spell, the wettest in at least 14 years, triggered devastating floods in Punjab, record Yamuna levels in Delhi, and landslides in the Himalayas.

title: Superbowl recap: Philadelphia Eagles prevail over Dallas Cowboys - Key highlights
content: The Philadelphia Eagles commenced their Super Bowl defense with a hard-fought 24-20 victory over the Dallas Cowboys in a game marked by early drama and a mid-game lightning delay. Despite an early ejection and dropped passes from CeeDee Lamb, the Eagles demonstrated resilience, with Jalen Hurts leading crucial drives, securing a thrilling NFC East opener win.

title: Sheena Bora murder trial: Indrani Mukerjea's daughter Vidhie concludes deposition
content: In the Sheena Bora murder trial, Vidhie Mukerjea concluded her deposition, alleging financial misconduct by stepbrothers and drug abuse by Rahul Mukerjea. She admitted to writing a book influenced by misinformation and expressed regret over its contents. Vidhie also cited "privileged information" when questioned about a New Zealand bank account and denied knowledge of specific financial dealings involving her parents.

title: US Open 2025: Bhambri's dream run ends in semis
content: Joe Salisbury and Neal Skupski of Britain triumphed over India's Yuki Bhambri and Michael Venus in a thrilling US Open semifinal. After dropping the first set, the British pair rallied to win 6(2)-7, 7-6(5), 6-4. Bhambri and Venus, despite a strong tournament run including impressive victories, couldn't maintain their early lead.

title: ‚ÄòKnife on son‚Äôs neck‚Äô: Delivery boy forces Noida woman to strip, records video
content: Gaurav, a 23-year-old hairdresser and grocery delivery person, was arrested for allegedly blackmailing a Greater Noida woman. He reportedly forced her to strip at knifepoint, threatening her children, and recorded explicit content. He then harassed her for months, sharing the images with her husband and online, leading to her reporting him to the police.

title: 'No solution on battlefield': India flags Ukraine conflict at UN
content: At the UNGA, India's envoy Parvathaneni Harish urged dialogue to resolve the Ukraine conflict, emphasizing the human cost and advocating for humanitarian aid. He welcomed diplomatic efforts like the Alaska Summit and highlighted PM Modi's engagement with global leaders. Harish also addressed the conflict's global economic impact, particularly rising fuel prices.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 24,800; BSE Sensex crosses 81,000 mark
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Friday as the market continued to react positively to GST rate cute announcements. While Nifty50 was above 24,800, BSE Sensex was up almost 300 points.

title: Asia Cup: Yuvraj's advice to Gill, Abhishek: 'Don‚Äôt repeat my mistake'
content: Yuvraj Singh is encouraging young cricketers Shubman Gill and Abhishek Sharma to take up golf, drawing from his own experiences. He believes that incorporating golf into their routine can help them relax, reduce mental fatigue, and ultimately improve their performance on the cricket field.

title: Pickles or whisky? Pickle parcel scam to dry Bihar unmasked
content: Ahead of Bihar's assembly elections, liquor smuggling attempts are escalating. Railway Protection Force seized a 'pickle' shipment at Varanasi Junction, uncovering 283 whisky bottles destined for Patna. This follows previous incidents, including the discovery of 316 bottles on the Lucknow-Barauni Express and arrests in Gorakhpur, highlighting intensified efforts to smuggle alcohol into the dry state.

title: Top shares to buy: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research suggests Adani Ports and Jayaswal Neco Industries as top stock picks for September 5, 2025. NIFTY is expected to consolidate between 24,400 and 25,000. A move above 25,000 could lead to 25,250.
